Description of incident: Customers who used payment cards in several store locations discovered fraudulent charges on their debit and credit cards.  It is unclear if a breach affected the physical machines in the stores or if the payment processing system was hacked.  The company discovered the issue on December 4 and an investigation revealed that the intrusions began on November 7, 2012.  Anyone who used their payment card in a store between November 7 and December 5 of 2012 should closely review their financial statements.  Customers are also warned to be suspicious of phishing emails or phone calls.  Customers should not give their information out over the phone or respond to emails asking for sensitive information.
